title: How did the Canary Island of Gomera take its name? - Quora

response.answer_text: The name comes from the aboriginal name for the island, transcribed by some as “Ghomara”. The origin of the name isn’t clear, although some think it may be related to the berber tribe of the Ghomaras from the north of Morocco, although as far as I know there is no definitive evidence. Worth mentioning that the Peñón de Vélez de la Gomera (off the Mediterranean coast of Morocco where the Ghomaras live) also bears that name. I personally think the theory is plausible since the original inhabitants of the Canary islands were related to the Berbers, but given the lack of written records of their language and the poor historical records from the Castillian conquest of the islands it won’t be possible to be completely sure.
